intro: Thesium confertum, commonly known as the clustered thesium, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Xanthorrhoeaceae. It is native to Australia and is characterized by its compact, mat-forming growth habit. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in open, sunny habitats. Thesium confertum is notable for its ability to tolerate arid conditions and is considered a hardy, drought-resistant species.
